measured_by: 7-point Likert response to the question “How safe is it?” / 7-point Likert response to the question “How dangerous is it?” (reverse-coded)
justification: “Participants in the Safe Group judged the scenarios by answering the question 'How safe is it?' responding on a 7-point scale … Participants in the Danger Group judged the same scenarios by answering the question 'How dangerous is it?' responding on a 7-point scale …”

measured_by: Single item 'Would you ski this slope?' with response options No / I cannot say / Yes
justification: “Upon completing each risk judgment, participants … were asked the question 'Would you ski this slope?' with the three response options 'No', 'I cannot say' or 'Yes'.”

measured_by: Self-reported 7-point scale ranging from '1 – None' to '7 – Expert level qualifications'
justification: Table 2 notes “median level of self-reported avalanche safety training … reported on 7-point scale with '1 - None' and '7 - Expert level qualifications' at the scale ends.”

measured_by: Self-reported number of years skiing in avalanche terrain (0–40 year scale)
justification: Table 2 lists “average number of years skiing in avalanche terrain (M Years , response scale from 0 to 40 years).”

measured_by: Self-reported average number of days in avalanche terrain per season (0–100 day scale)
justification: Table 2 lists “average number of days in avalanche terrain per season (M Days , response scale from 0 to 100 days).”
